top_categories.workout_context: At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Dirty 30's rolling Michigan gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Dirty 30's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
Dirty 30's Michigan forest roads, Rural gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Dirty 30. Train it until it feels boring.
At Dirty 30, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
100 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 3,500ft of climbing on rolling Michigan gravel does to your power file on race day.
When someone attacks on rolling Michigan gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 100 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.
Varied gradients on rolling Michigan gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.

race_overlay.heat: April in Saranac, Michigan can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Dirty 30. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Dirty 30’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Dirty 30 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on rolling michigan gravel to build confidence. Expect: michigan forest roads, rural gravel, rolling hills.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of rolling michigan gravel in Saranac, Michigan.
